channel.title: Plz help asap.so.i.can start something els

item.title: Plz help asap.so.i.can start something els
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Writing the email to the file would be as simple as:

[code=java]
BufferedWriter bw = null;

	try {
		bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("config//email list.txt", true));//change this
		bw.write(c.playerName+": "+c.playerEmail);//change this
		bw.newLine();
		bw.flush();
	} catch (IOException ioe) {
		ioe.printStackTrace();
	} finally {
		if (bw != null) {
			try {
				bw.close();
			} catch (IOException ioe2) {
				sM("Error with email!");
			}
		}
	}[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Plz help asap.so.i.can start something els

item.title: Plz help asap.so.i.can start something els
item.dc:creator: @kill_boy_98 kill boy 98
item.description:
@kill_boy_98 wrote:

so im adding an email sytem and so far i have this code

if (playerCommand.startsWith("email") && playerCommand.length() > 10) { if(c.playerEmail == "None") { c.playerEmail = playerCommand.substring(6); c.sendMessage("You have registered your account with the email " + c.playerEmail + "."); c.sendMessage("you will have to contact us and tell us some infomation like password and when you joined the game ."); } else if(c.playerEmail != "None") { c.sendMessage("There is already an email registered to this account."); } else if(playerCommand.length() < 10) { c.sendMessage("That email is not long enough."); } }

how would i make it so it have to have an @ how would i go about doin this also adding the email to a txt file
